content.description: Crouch start for shorter climbers with your left hand on a crimp gaston and your right hand on a bad sloper. Power left to a barely there crimp on the faint arete and then pop right to a horrible right hand one finger button. Jack your feet up, fire for the distant lip, match, and top out the slab.
content.location: Start about 3-4 feet left of the problem Storm Surge.

content.description: Move up from the the sit on terrible crimps, head right shooting for the slopey shelf, and then finish up the easy slab.
content.protection: Pads.  Watch the rock behind you.
content.location: This is on the face that faces the water.   Locate their smaller rock right in front of it and then the good foot bar.  Half the crux is finding the starting the holds.  There is a decent crimp at 1 o’clock that you are shooting for.

content.description: Sit start the undercut arête with your right hand on a decent crimp and your left hand on the arête. Move up on crimps, and top out.
content.location: On the backside of the boulder, this problem faces the hobo camp up on the hill.

content.description: Sit start the dead obvious, 45 degree overhanging roof with your left hand on a higher crimp and your right hand on a lower, decent sidepull. Power up to two slopers, and traverse right to crimps and a cool, loaded topout. This may be harder for shorter climbers as your feet cut loose after the sloper match, and you may need to campus to the crimps.
content.location: This is roughly in the center of the steepest side of the boulder.

content.description: This is a big, green, tent-shaped boulder near the homeless camp. It is a little reminiscent of a Pawtuckaway boulder.
